text:

[Student]: Do you know what your family is up to now asked Mary McGraw with her usual quick smile as she glanced out of the window into a dazed group at one side of the house where Mary had seen them in their long drive from Chicago until they were all seated together again by an open fire of The Rising Sun but which was one of the favorite groups on the little porch of Herb Cove opposite the house when the night came for them to see that it was not
[Teacher]: raining. It was clear and the moon was up. The stars were also clear and visible to see from the Cove, so they were all out on the cove there for their impromptu gathering to gaze at the night sky, to drink some tea, and to look at their watches. It was the first night of a new month and the night before the second month of the summer, with the fire burning and the wind blowing gently across the cove in the late evening. All that was
[Student]: said and done told about how goodly this city would be if only a few days passed without a sign from home
[Teacher]: .  While Mary McGraw was sitting there sipping her tea, she watched the group of friends, who were all dressed for a more adventurous trip.  All of them were dressed in long coats, with their long boots and their wide brimmed hats, which seemed to be more suited for travel than for a night spent on the cove.  Mary watched them and wondered why they were there.  She had seen them drive in on the morning before, but had not seen them again
